channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Parking, 28th December
item.description:
This van has been coming here to park and doesn’t live in this area nor is it a visitor. It has parked in this spot and taken up 2 bays as well as just been left there for days

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chalfont Green, Edmonton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cracks through the road throughout, pot holes 10” wide, 28th December
item.description:
Road not strong enough for speeding double decker buses Road not strong enough for speeding double decker buses Rattles my house at all hours Please fix and stop closing with ‘fixed’

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Blackfen, Greater London

item.title: Drain cover has become loose, 28th December
item.description:
Manhole/ drain cover has become very loose and as the cars drive over is making a lot of noise. I fear the cover will fall inside. There are 2 covers that are making a lot of noise and becoming extremely loose. Have reported before and not been fixed and just getting worse and worse

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Plumstead High Street, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping....yet again, 28th December
item.description:
Furniture dumped including a door and long pieces of wood and metal. All items that can be taken to local recycle centre. Moved where they can be easily collected instead being hidden in the corner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pitman Street, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: South Croxted Road SE21 streetlight column ID 16, 28th December
item.description:
South Croxted Road SE21 streetlight column ID 16 (diagonally opposite Church Approach junction / few yards from Clive Passage junction) graffiti tagged – yes on west side footpath ie Lambeth side but your streetlight. Picture attached noting your lamp ID tag.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Approach, Dulwich, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Missing a tree, 28th December
item.description:
A beautiful couple of trees has been removed from Queens road, which is a conservation area in Bromley Town. This has affected the look and feel of the street. It's also affected the noise pollution coming from the main road. Can new trees be planted?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queens Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped bathroom pieces, 28th December
item.description:
Someone dumped this stuff in a neighbours paid for skip! Hirer of skip quite rightly removed from their skip as not for the use of neighbours. Please can this bathroom furniture be removed. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Barham Road, Chislehurst, Greater London

item.title: Clive Passage SE21 at South Croxted Road / Emmanuel, 28th December
item.description:

item.title: Rubbish, 28th December
item.description:
At the back of my property of 26 malthus path people have been dumping there rubbish for example fish tank bed base etc and it is begrimmed the whole pathway needs an over haul and thoroughly cleared of all rubbish as this pathway is a disabled access route to my house
